title: Decomposing Lujvo
goal: Practice breaking down lujvo into component rafsi.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Lujvo review:

jbobau = ? + ?
brivla = ? + ?
selsku = ? + ?

(Answers: jbo + bau, briv + la, sel + sku)

New Material (5-7 min)

Decomposition Strategy

To understand a lujvo:

  1. Identify the rafsi — Look for 3-4 letter chunks
  2. Match to gismu — What gismu does each rafsi come from?
  3. Combine meanings — How do they relate?

Example: jbobau

jbobau
│    │
jbo  bau
│    │
lojbo bangu
│    │
Lojban language

Example: brivla

brivla
│    │
briv  la
│    │
bridi valsi
│    │
predicate word

Example: glibau

glibau
│    │
gli  bau
│    │
glico bangu
│    │
English language

Common Rafsi to Know

Rafsi From Gismu Meaning
jbo lojbo Lojbanic
gli glico English
bau bangu language
briv bridi predicate
la, vla valsi word
sel se (conversion)
sku cusku say/express

Using Dictionaries

The jbovlaste (Lojban dictionary) lists:

  • All lujvo with their definitions
  • Component rafsi breakdowns
  • Related words

Key Point

Decomposing lujvo helps you understand new words and remember their meanings.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Decompose These Lujvo

Break down each lujvo:

  1. seljmi = ?
  2. selsku = ?
  3. jbobau = ?
Answers
  1. sel (se) + jmi (jimpe) = what is understood
  2. sel (se) + sku (cusku) = what is said
  3. jbo (lojbo) + bau (bangu) = Lojban language

Exercise 2: Guess Meanings

Based on components, what might each mean?

  1. fasybau (fasy = from Farsi + bau = language)
  2. seltavla (sel = se + tavla)
  3. terbri (ter = te + bri = bridi)
Answers
  1. Persian/Farsi language
  2. What is talked about (the topic)
  3. x3 of bridi (possibly the relationship itself)

Exercise 3: Match Lujvo to Meaning

Match:

  1. jbobau a. what is said
  2. glibau b. Lojban
  3. selsku c. English
  4. seljmi d. what is understood
Answers

1-b, 2-c, 3-a, 4-d

items.answer: x3 of bridi (possibly the relationship itself)

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I understand what is said." → mi jimpe lo selsku
  2. "Lojban is beautiful." → la jbobau cu melbi
  3. "I speak English and Lojban." → mi tavla fo la glibau .e la jbobau

Today's Vocab

Review — focus on decomposition skills.

Key rafsi:

Rafsi Source Meaning
jbo lojbo Lojbanic
gli glico English
bau bangu language
sel se (x1↔x2 swap)
sku cusku say
jmi jimpe understand

Summary

You practiced decomposing lujvo into rafsi components. This skill helps you understand new compound words.
